title: Frustrated Pep Guardiola bemoans VAR and sarcastically says Kevin de Bruyne was 'diving'
text:
Pep Guardiola's seething frustration with the implementation of VAR surfaced as he appeared to be scathing about the decision not to award Manchester City a penalty in the 68th minute.

When Wifried Zaha bundled Kevin De Bruyne over in the box, ref Anthony Taylor ruled the contact normal and, having explained as much to the VAR, under the Premier League protocol, the decision stood.

But asked whether it should have been a penalty, Guardiola answered with apparent sarcasm, referring to De Bruyne, saying: 'He was diving.'

Pep Guardiola's frustration with the implementation of VAR surfaced in a press conference

When it was put to Guardiola that his response sounded like he thought it was a penalty, he continued on his theme.

'He's diving, he's diving. Every weekend he's diving for penalties.'

Then, referring to Gabriel Jesus' disallowed goal in injury time against Spurs earlier in the season, Guardiola added: 'But against Tottenham it was hands. 94 minutes.'

Told that he sounded frustrated, Guardiola said: 'That's because I am. For a long time.'

When Wifried Zaha bundled Kevin De Bruyne over in the box, the ref ruled the contact normal

When it was suggested VAR might be expected to overturn such decisions, Guardiola declined to answer and called for the next question.

Despite the decisions the Spaniard thinks went against his side, they were still able to collect the three points away to Crystal Palace.

Two goals in as many minutes, from David Silva and Gabriel Jesus, was enough to see of Palace and keep the pressure on Liverpool at the top of the Premier League table.
